page.title: 19Graig-yr-Hesg quarry
page.content: Graig-yr-Hesg quarry is on the outskirts of Pontypridd.It is a gritstone quarry which makes aggregates for roadstone materials.It is a quality stone because it is hard-wearing and its very high anti-skid characteristics.It is used to make hot tarmacs for laying on the roads locally within a radius of 40 miles.Chippings from Graig-yr-Hesg have been sold as far away as Falkirk in Scotland,Cornwall and Kent.The quarry produces approximately 200,000 tonnes of crushed rock each year,of which about half is sold as Bitumen coated materials.There are 30 hourly paid employees and 4 staff permanently employed at the quarry,with outside firms to transport the chippings. (From Trefforest CP school:Katherine Ashman,Julie Porter,Darren Kendall, Sarah Langham.)
